intro: Odisha bonaccordensis, commonly known as the Odisha bonaccord, is a unique flowering plant native to the dense forests of Odisha, India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with white petals and prominent yellow stamens. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found near the forest floor. Its leaves are elliptical and have a slightly glossy surface, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
